alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 1:30PM EDT until August 07 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in South Central Ohio, Pike and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Lucasville, Clarktown, Beaver, Rarden, Otway, Bear Creek, Wakefield, Mcdermott, Lombardsville, Germany, State Route 335 at State Route 776, Mount Joy, Stockdale and Minford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
